docs.lead_paragraph: Despite all the mortal threats it faces, this continent could yet represent a beacon of hope engendered by a spirit of collaboration.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new type of blood test is starting to transform cancer treatment, sparing some patients the surgical and needle biopsies long needed to guide their care.

headline.main: New Blood Tests, Liquid Biopsies, May Transform Cancer Care
headline.print_headline: New Blood Tests, Liquid Biopsies, May Transform Cancer Care

docs.snippet: A new type of blood test is starting to transform cancer treatment, sparing some patients the surgical and needle biopsies long needed to guide their care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some ingredients used in nail products have been tied to cancer, miscarriages, lung diseases and other ailments. The industry has long fought regulations.

headline.print_headline: Behind Perfect Nails, Ailing Salon Workers

docs.abstract: Research and anecdotal evidence suggest that manicurists are exposed to higher risk of serious health conditions, including cancer and respiratory and skin ailments; incidence of miscarriage and birth defects appears to be so high that women in industry warn those of child-bearing age away from profession; conclusive research on nail workers and illness remains sparse, and few regulations exist to protect those who work with chemicals on daily basis (Series: Unvarnished).
docs.snippet: Some ingredients used in nail products have been tied to cancer, miscarriages, lung diseases and other ailments. The industry has long fought regulations.

keywords.value: National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jiha Ham, Yuhan Liu, Julie Turkewitz, Isvett Verde, Yeong-Ung Yang and Heyang Zhang, and research by Susan C. Beachy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Inclusion on the list indicates to governments and drug companies that those medicines should be made available to poor countries at low prices.

headline.main: Hepatitis C Drugs Added to W.H.O. List of Essential Medicines
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Science and Health; W.H.O. Adds Hepatitis C Drugs to List of Essential Medicines to Foster Access

docs.abstract: World Health Organization includes five new hepatitis C drugs on essential medicines list for first time, indication to government, regulators and companies that pricey drugs should be made available at lower prices in poorer countries.
docs.snippet: Inclusion on the list indicates to governments and drug companies that those medicines should be made available to poor countries at low prices.
